text: Then, in spite of the emotions he felt at the sight of the diamond, but, to his great surprise, the latter, who had watched with sincere pity the young man from head to foot.

passages.full_quote: <used>Then, in spite of the</used> wind and rain, he fell into the deep, sweet sleep of utter exhaustion

passages.fragment: , in spite of the emotions he felt at the sight of
passages.full_quote: She was in tears, and, strange as it was<used>, in spite of the emotions he felt at the sight of</used> these tears, he looked also at Madame de Villefort, and it appeared to him as if a slight gloomy smile had passed over her thin lips, like a meteor seen passing inauspiciously between two clouds in a stormy sky

But however the mind of the young man might be absorbed in these reflections, they were at once dispersed <used>at the sight of the</used> dark frowning ruins of the stupendous Colosseum, through the various openings of which the pale moonlight played and flickered like the unearthly gleam from the eyes of the wandering dead
At <used>the sight of the diamond, w</used>hich was as large as a hazel-nut, La Carconte's eyes sparkled with cupidity.

I felt some degree of nervousness as I entered upon the history <used>of the diamond, but, to</used> my inexpressible astonishment, he confirmed it in every particular, and to my equal surprise, he seemed to place entire belief in all I said

passages.fragment: , but , to his great surprise , the latter ,
passages.full_quote: Albert expected to have something new this time to show to the traveller, <used>but, to his great surprise, the latter, w</used>ithout seeking for the signatures, many of which, indeed, were only initials, named instantly the author of every picture in such a manner that it was easy to see that each name was not only known to him, but that each style associated with it
Full of this idea, Villefort's face became so joyous, that when he turned to Dantès, <used>the latter, who had watched</used> the change on his physiognomy, was smiling also

passages.fragment: , who had watched with sincere pity the young man
passages.full_quote: Beauchamp<used>, who had watched with sincere pity the young man</used>'s paroxysm of grief, approached him
remarked Danglars, affecting to <used>pity the young man from</used> the bottom of his heart

passages.fragment: the young man from head to foot
passages.full_quote: The scrutinizing glance of the count searched <used>the young man from head to foot</used>
